description: Prior notification under Class MA of Part 3, Schedule 2, of the GPDO 2015 to change the use from offices (Use Class E) to two residential units (Use Class C3).
decision_conditions: <p>Prior to the first occupation of the development, a noise impact assessment outlining mitigation measures that will ensure that the existing noise generating premises would not have a significant adverse effect on the future occupiers shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved, which shall be retained in perpetuity thereafter.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the proposed units shall benefit from a high standard of accommodation.</p>

<p>The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.</p>

<p>The development hereby approved under Class MA must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the prior approval date.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In accordance with condition MA.2 (5) of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of the The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015.</p>

<p>Any development permitted to be used as a dwellinghouse is to remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of the Schedule to the Use Classes Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the use as a dwellinghouse.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To comply with the requirements of MA.2 (6) of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of the The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015.</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development, detailed layout drawings of the proposed refuse store shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved, which shall be retained in perpetuity thereafter.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that reasonable and permanent provision of sufficient waste storage capacity is made within the site and to preserve the appearance of the site.</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of works hereby approved, a scheme shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority subject to the completion of a s106 legal agreement and be put in place with associated monitoring to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident/commercial occupier of the development shall obtain a resident/commercial parking permit within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time, nor a season ticket/enter into a contract to park in any car park controlled by the Council.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development does not generate an increased demand for on-street car parking to the detriment of the free flow of traffic, the conditions of general safety along the neighbouring highways, the amenity of the area and to accord with the Councils car parking policy and standards.</p>
